definition: to grasp/(dialect) affecting shyness/coy/to create difficulties
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
old variant of 拿[na2]
variant of 拿[na2]
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
variant of 捏[nie1]

sentences.english: How to execute the law, Sun Jianguo said that the" of" hard to handle.
sentences.chinese: 对于如何执法，孙建国表示这个“度”很难拿捏。

sentences.english: Minnelli's sensibilities were perfect for it – the sensitivity and the bravado.
sentences.chinese: 明奈利对情感与虚张声势的拿捏是无可挑剔的。

sentences.english: Apply pressure and stroke yourself using your favorite techniques.
sentences.chinese: 按压和拿捏的方式类型用你的最爱。

sentences.english: Finding the line between disapproval, pressure and continued engagement will be hard.
sentences.chinese: 在反对，施压，以及持续介入之间拿捏分寸是困难的。

definition: propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
it's just perfect/it's just right
heat control/maturity/crucial moment
to grasp (also fig.)/to seize/to hold/assurance/certainty/sure (of the outcome)
(idiom) appropriate/apt/just right
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
to analyze/to try to figure out/to try to fathom
strength/power/efficacy
subtle
to control/in control of
skillful/proficient
severity (of the case)/degree of seriousness/whether sth is slight or serious
to advance or retreat/knowing when to come and when to leave/a sense of propriety
handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
ruthless/fierce/ferocious/determined/to harden (one's heart)/old variant of 很[hen3]
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
